demographics: The New Parents represent a generation navigating parenthood with both excitement and anxiety. Typically in their late 20s to late 30s, they’re balancing work, wellness, and identity while learning to prioritize safety, stability, and family moments. They value design, reliability, and technology that supports—not overwhelms—their lifestyle. They don’t want to lose who they are now that they have kids; they want products that evolve with them. For this group, vehicles are more than transportation — they’re extensions of family rhythm, enabling both connection and escape.
psychographics: Late 20s–30s, dual-income households, suburban or near-urban, college-educated. Tech-forward, research-oriented, emotionally intelligent, and values-driven.
emotionalDrivers: Seek safety, trustworthiness, and control during a period of life filled with unpredictability. They’re drawn to products that make life smoother and parenting feel less overwhelming.
valuesAspirations: Stability, quality time, growth, and experiences that strengthen family connection. They aspire to build memories, not just routines.
painPoints: Feeling stretched between work and family responsibilities. Need for safety and convenience without sacrificing aesthetics. Fear of losing personal identity to parenting
culturalMoments: Bringing baby home for the first time, family road trips, daycare drop-offs, and spontaneous weekend escapes — the Telluride becomes part of each chapter.
preferredTone: Warm, grounded, and cinematic — celebrating the chaos and beauty of early parenthood with authenticity and optimism.
desiredTransformation: From anxious new parents to confident caregivers who feel capable and calm on the road ahead.
name: The Family-Oriented Parent
